title: Citi to Coordinate with China General Certification Center (CGC) on Renewable Energy Standards
summary: Washington, DC - Citi today announced a memorandum of understanding (MOU) with the China General Certification Center (CGC) to advance the development of China's renewable energy sector.
tag-1: Citi to Coordinate with China General Certification Center (CGC) on Renewable Energy Standards
tag-2: Washington, DC – Citi today announced a memorandum of understanding (MOU) with the China General Certification Center (CGC) to advance the development of China's renewable energy sector.
tag-3: Pursuant to the MOU, signed at the U.S.-China Renewable Energy Forum in Washington, DC, Citi and the CGC will work together to enhance investor confidence in the renewable energy sector through the exploration and promotion of common standards, testing and certification of advanced technologies.
tag-4: "Citi is very pleased to enter this understanding with China General Certification Center," said Michael Eckhart, Managing Director and Global Head of Environmental Finance at Citi. "Technical standards are increasingly important as the wind turbine industry goes global, with Chinese equipment being installed in many countries. It is very important to a global financier like Citi to understand the standards, and to have a cooperative relationship with standards agencies like CGC so that our due diligence can be accurate and thorough."
tag-5: The MOU contemplates that Citi and CGC will cooperate on research exploring the link between technical standards and financial services in the renewable energy field.
tag-6: "As improvements in technology have driven down costs in the renewable energy sector, wind and solar energy have been earmarked for large-scale development. With increasing investment in this space, involvement of banks and other financial institutions become more important in this sector," said Qin Haiyan, General Director of CGC. "As a professional technical service provider, CGC is willing to work closely with Citi to address concerns about capital risks and investment returns in the sector through the development of standards, testing and certification in order to promote the growth of renewable energy."
tag-7: The MOU sets forth the agreement in principle of the parties concerning the project and related activities.
tag-8: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
tag-9: Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com | Twitter: @Citi | YouTube: www.youtube.com/citi | Blog: http://new.citi.com | Facebook: www.facebook.com/citi | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/citi
tag-10: CGC CGC is a leading third-party technical services provider with the authorization of the Certification and Accreditation Administration of China (CNCA). The current services include testing, certification, post project evaluation, due diligence and trainings in terms of wind power equipments, solar water heaters and PV products as well as energy audit for low-carbon and energy efficiency sector. More information could refer to www.cgc.org.cn.
